headline: Sherwin-Williams cuts outlook, Philip Morris raises outlook
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Sherwin-Williams (SHW) reported a miss for the second quarter and cut its full-year guidance. Philip Morris (PM) mostly topped second quarter estimates but fell short on organic revenue growth expectations. The company also raised its full-year profit forecast. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Stocks Little Changed as Earnings Pour In
summary: Stocks were mixed at the open on Tuesday as Wall Street sifted through the latest wave of earnings reports and looked ahead to the big names due out in the days and weeks to come.  The Nasdaq Composite was down 0.2%.  “You can’t fault investors for taking a step back to catch their breath as earnings season picks up and we approach the August 1st tariff deadlines,” writes Bespoke Investment Group co-founder Paul Hickey.

headline: Paintmaker Sherwin-Williams cuts 2025 profit forecast on soft demand
summary: Sherwin-Williams cut full-year adjusted profit forecast and missed second-quarter earnings estimate on Tuesday, hit by soft demand for paint products, sending the company's shares down more than 4% in premarket trading. A sharp drop in new U.S. home sales could weigh on paintmakers by reducing the demand for construction-related coatings, materials and paints. "Demand was softer than anticipated through June, and we do not see catalysts to change that trajectory at this time, causing us to adjust our full-year guidance downward," said Heidi Petz, CEO at Sherwin-Williams — one of the world's largest coating makers.

raw.headline: Paintmaker Sherwin-Williams cuts 2025 profit forecast on soft demand
raw.summary: Sherwin-Williams cut full-year adjusted profit forecast and missed second-quarter earnings estimate on Tuesday, hit by soft demand for paint products, sending the company's shares down more than 4% in premarket trading. A sharp drop in new U.S. home sales could weigh on paintmakers by reducing the demand for construction-related coatings, materials and paints. "Demand was softer than anticipated through June, and we do not see catalysts to change that trajectory at this time, causing us to adjust our full-year guidance downward," said Heidi Petz, CEO at Sherwin-Williams — one of the world's largest coating makers.

headline: Sherwin-Williams (NYSE:SHW) Posts Q2 Sales In Line With Estimates
summary: Paint and coating manufacturer Sherwin-Williams (NYSE:SHW) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, but sales were flat year on year at $6.31 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $6.16 billion was less impressive, coming in 2.2% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $3.38 per share was 11.2% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Sherwin-Williams (NYSE:SHW) Posts Q2 Sales In Line With Estimates

headline: Sherwin-Williams Stock Drops After Earnings Miss Earnings Expectations
summary: Sherwin-Williams  stock was falling Tuesday after the maker of paints and coatings missed expectations for second-quarter earnings and revised its full-year guidance downward.  The company posted adjusted earnings of $3.38 a share, down from $3.70 last year and below Wall Street’s consensus estimate of $3.80.  Net sales climbed to $6.31 billion from $6.27 billion last year, narrowly beating analysts’ expectations of $6.3 billion.

raw.headline: Sherwin-Williams Stock Drops After Earnings Miss Earnings Expectations

Net sales climbed to $6.31 billion from $6.27 billion last year, narrowly beating analysts’ expectations of $6.3 billion.

headline: Sherwin-Williams: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: CLEVELAND (AP) — Sherwin-Williams Co. (SHW) on Tuesday reported second-quarter earnings of $754.7 million. On a per-share basis, the Cleveland-based company said it had net income of $3. Earnings, adjusted for costs related to mergers and acquisitions and severance costs, were $3.38 per share.
